author: Special Correspondent
text:
Finance Minister O. Panneerselvam on Thursday said the public debt of Tamil Nadu was well within the limit prescribed by the Finance Commission.

Responding to apprehensions raised by Congress MLA S. Vijayadharani on financial situation , he said that between 2011 and 2015, the State borrowed loans to the tune of Rs. 78,617.31 crore. In the same period, capital expenditure was to the tune of Rs 76,510.67 crore. This money was used to create capital assets. The State had devotedly kept to the recommendations of the 14{+t}{+h}Finance Commission and has maintained the debt ratio at less than 25 per cent of Gross State Domestic Product (GSDP). Currently, the total debts was only 19.23 per cent of the GSDP.

title: State finances under control: Panneerselvam
